{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3552151,"name":"Lucas D","username":"KrazyKactus","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/9dc877/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-09T21:10:36.389Z","cooked":"

Hey, so our elevator, rather than having a smooth up and down movement when controlled will jerk when moving.

We’re using Spark Max controllers and Neo Brushless motors.

Regardless of the control type, there is some sort of jerk and I can’t figure out what parameter wasn’t passed correctly.

The output drops and goes back up a bunch during movement:

Screenshot_2025-03-09-17-08-36-80_92460851df6f172a4592fca41cc2d2e62376×1080 170 KB

Here’s a graph, with red being the current, green being voltage, and purple being the applied output

I can also post my code if this isn’t an obvious fix

Can’t see the scale for amps, or applied output.
How are you controlling the elevator - pid ? feedforward?
How many motors?
Does it run smoothly manually or jogging at constant rate?
Tried lower accel and velocity?

So we factory defaulted the spark maxes and it fixed it, so don’t worry about this, I’ll post here again in case it goes wrong again but it works fine now lol
